body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Remove the inspection plate from the right hand crankshaft cover.

body.name: Camshaft Drive Chain Tensioner - NN3_NN4 - Removal (casg)

body.body: Rotate the crankshaft clockwise (the normal direction of rotation), using the fixing fitted to the end of the crankshaft. Stop rotation when number 1 cylinder is at top dead centre (TDC), that is when the 'T1' mark on the sprag clutch aligns with the line at the bottom of the cover.
In addition to the 'T1' mark alignment, at TDC, the alignment marks on the camshafts will point inwards at a point level with the joint face of the cylinder head and the camshaft cover.

body.name: Camshaft Drive Chain Tensioner - N Series- Installation (gaaa_3)

body.body: Camshaft to Cylinder Head Alignment Marks
Place a suitable wedge between the tensioner blade and crankcase, to hold the camshaft drive chain taut during removal of the tensioner.

The tensioner centre nut is under spring tension. Always wear hand, eye and face protection when withdrawing the centre nut and take great care in order to minimise the risk of injury and loss of components.
Carefully remove the centre nut from the tensioner and withdraw the tensioner spring.

body.name: Camshaft Drive Chain Tensioner - N Series - Removal (caom)

body.body: Remove the fixings securing the tensioner to the cylinder head. Remove the tensioner and discard the gasket.
